intro: Freycinetia pauperata, commonly known as the poor freycinetia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Pandanaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its slender, arching stems and narrow, sword-shaped leaves that are often used in traditional crafts. Freycinetia pauperata produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters, adding ornamental value to the plant. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing in lowland forests or on rocky outcrops.
